span.strong: Click here to access the Special Board of Education Meeting starting at 7:00 p.m. tonight.

br.span: Rationale to delay the closing of Spruce Primary, converting Chestnut to a Primary School, and re-districting all K-5 school boundary lines for the 2020 – 2021 School Year

span.strong: Please click here to access information and updates about the coronavirus.

img.title: logo image
img.a: Redistricting - Updated Proposed Boundaries for 20-21 School Year

br.span: Attached are updated versions of the proposed boundaries for the primary and intermediate schools for the 20-21 school year. The board of education will vote on these at their regular April meeting.

img.title: great lakes conference logo
img.a: North Olmsted Accepted into the Great Lakes Conference

span.span: North Olmsted City Schools has been invited to join the Great Lakes Conference beginning with the 2021-2022 school year. The North Olmsted Board of Education officially accepted this invitation at their regular meeting on February 19.

img.title: district logo
img.a: Board Approves Changes for 2020-2021 School Year

br.span: This week the North Olmsted Board of Education unanimously approved the recommendation to close Spruce Primary School effective for the 2020-2021 school year. The recommendation also included converting Chestnut Intermediate School to a PreK-2 Primary School, reconfiguring the remaining PreK-5 facilities, and redistricting all school boundary lines.

span.span: The State of the Schools Presentation was held on November 18, 2019. Attached is the complete presentation from that evening.

img.title: north olmsted logo
img.a: Facilities Master Plan Phase Two - Presentation and Recommendation

span.span: During the December 18th regular meeting of the North Olmsted Board of Education, a formal presentation and recommendation was made regarding the Facilities Master Plan Phase ll. Attached is the complete presenation and recomendation.

The Community Task Force for Facilities Master Plan Committee was comprised of a cross section of stakeholders including parents, teachers, principals, community members, and other school officials. The committee was also assisted by several planning consultants throughout the course of the study.

img.title: survey results image
img.a: Facilities Planning Survey Phase Two - Fall 2019

span.span: The district conducted a Facilities Planning Survey starting October 22, 2019 and ending November 4, 2019. Attached are the complete survey results.

During the months of October and November, Superintendent Dr. Zalar hosted several community conversations. These community meetings discussed the districts primary and intermediate facilities. Attached is the complete presentation from those community conversations.
The website accessibility policy and guidelines are attached.
